<section begin=summary />{{translation|'''Six Paths Sage Mode'''|六道仙人モード|Rikudō Sennin Mōdo}} is a divine transformation gifted by [[Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki]] to those who have an iron faith and the will to never give up.<ref name="d4">''[[Jin no Sho]]'', page 310</ref> It significantly enhances the user's powers and allows them to use a number of new techniques.<section end=summary />

This state is indicated with Naruto's pupils consisting of a cross of vertical [[Kurama|fox]]-slits with horizontal [[toad]]-slits, and there is no pigmentation around his eyes that would otherwise signify the standard [[Sage Mode]].<ref name="ch672">''Naruto'' chapter 672, page 17</ref> Since Naruto first awakened this power, he has always used it simultaneously with the [[Nine-Tails Chakra Mode]]. Directly after obtaining [[Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki]]'s power, Naruto's eyes are yellow<ref name="Vol70">[[Volume 70]] cover</ref> and later orange with the various chakra modes he uses after [[Fourth Shinobi World War|the war]], just like his previous ones before meeting Hagoromo.<ref name="BorutoMovie">''[[Boruto: Naruto the Movie]]''</ref> This mode increases the user's physical parameters well above that of Sage Mode and the Nine-Tails Chakra Mode,<ref name="d4" /> as Naruto was able to kick away [[Truth-Seeking Ball]]s before entering the Nine-Tails Chakra Mode with this power.<ref name="ch672"/> As a heightened state of Sage Mode, Naruto's [[jutsu]] are augmented with larger amounts of [[natural energy]] to make them stronger. With the power he received from Hagoromo, Naruto gains a masterful grasp of chakra, control over all things in nature, and the ability to comprehend all universal things.<ref name="d4" /> His [[sensing]] ability also rises to the point where he can sense and thus react to the invisible shadows in the world of [[Limbo]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 674, pages 6-7</ref>

When Naruto uses his Nine-Tails Chakra Mode in conjunction with his Six Paths Sage Mode, he can push his abilities even further, such as being able to levitate,<ref name="d4" /><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 680, page 12</ref> becoming fast enough to catch [[Kaguya Ōtsutsuki]] off guard and slice off her right arm,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 687, page 16</ref> even being durable enough to take a [[Chidori]] unharmed.<ref name="ch695">''Naruto'' chapter 695, page 5</ref>

== Trivia ==
{{imgRight|Naruto NTCM and SPSM Digital.png|Naruto's eyes in the original colourised chapters.}}
* It's unclear what this form's name signifies, and consequentially what the best translation is. "Six Paths Sage Mode" suggests it is a version of [[Sage Mode]] augmented with the [[Six Paths]]. "Sage of Six Paths Mode" would suggest it is named after [[Hagoromo Ōtsutsuki]], better known as the Sage of Six Paths. The original Japanese supports both translations, and in fact could intend for both meanings to be true.
* In ''[[Shikamaru Hiden]]'', it is suggested that having the chakra of all nine [[tailed beast]]s is also a requirement to obtain this mode.
* In the colourised versions of chapters [[The Infinite Dream|676]] and [[My Will Is|678]] included in digital editions of ''Weekly Shōnen Jump'', Naruto's eyes in this mode were depicted with orange irides, much like his previous transformations. Later illustrations coloured by [[Masashi Kishimoto]] instead depict Naruto with yellow irides. The colouration was corrected in subsequent chapters and the ''[[Naruto: Colour Edition]]'' release of [[Naruto and the Sage of Six Paths…!! (volume)|volume 71]].
* In VIZ Shonen Jump, Naruto's Six Paths Sage Mode was attributed to the [[Six Paths Yang Power]]. However, this is not mentioned in the manga or the databooks.
* In ''Boruto: Naruto Next Generations'' chapter 52, Naruto asked about the difference between "Baryon Mode" and "Kurama Mode and Sage of Six Paths Mode" to Kurama. It is suggested that he was using the latter forms when he fought [[Isshiki Ōtsutsuki]].
